item.title: [DISTRELEC-2875] MyAccount: Info text for "allowed permissions" at sub-users
item.description: Please substitute info text for "allowed permissions" (currently reads Info Info Info)
item.summary: MyAccount: Info text for "allowed permissions" at sub-users

comments.comment: Oana, do you have the correct information text here? Otherwise please let me know who can provide this. Thanks!
I will delete this text.

Raphael,

I deleted Info, Info, Info
userdetailform.allowedPermissions.createProjectNumbersInfo

but it does not seem saved

Could you please check?

Actually you edited the wrong property.
This one is the correct and has been already adjusted: userdetailform.allowedPermissions.requestQuotationsInfo

So there is no text anymore.
the issue was solved.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2826] Ähnliche Produkte
item.description:
Vgl. http://test.distrelec.at/de/Schliesssystem-f%C3%BCr-Desktop-und-Peripherie-Kensington-K64615EU/p/11026276?q=*&filter_Category3=B%C3%BCrozubeh%C3%B6r&filter_Buyable=1&page=4&origPageSize=10&simi=100

1) Für den das im Module 'Ähnliche Produkte' implementierte Teaser-Tracking wird bis dato kein Request abgesetzt.

2) Zudem: Für die einzelnen Elemente ist das Teaser-Tracking 3-mal d.h. pro dediziertem Link implementiert (d.h. nicht einmalig pro div-Element - vgl. Screenshot blau markiert) //

3) Für das Element 'Adapter Kit für Kensington Sicherheitsbuchse' (vgl. Screenshot rot markiert) ist scheint gar kein Teaser-Tracking implementiert zu sein.

--> Please refactor

Thx Mark
item.summary: Ähnliche Produkte

comments.comment:
1) Da die Teaser beim Page Load nicht sichtbar sind, sollen diese mittels ckv : '1' und Javascript getrackt werden, so wie das Carousel?

2) Das ist mit Absicht. Beim Produkt, kann man auf den Titel oder das Bild klicken, daher ist bei beiden Link Tags das Tracking eingebaut. Soll es nur noch beim Titel eingebaut sein? Ein einzelner Link über das gesamte Produkt ist nicht umsetzbar (Crossbrowser Issues), daher mehrere Links pro Produkt.

3) Abgelaufene Produkte können nicht angeklickt werden und können somit auch nicht getracked werden. Aber bei Favorite und shopping Lists hat das Teaser Tracking gefehlt, ist nun hinzugefügt.

1 + 2) Ich würde dazu gerne erst die Funktionalität bzw. diese beiden Punkte verifizieren, sobald DISTRELEC-2170 (jetzt resolved) deployed ist. Ich habe den Verdacht, dass die Funktionalität 'eingeschränkt' ist, da sämtliche Elemente momentan die gleiche ID haben (at.ons.x.-). Gilt übrigens analog auch für die Product-Listings auf Basis von Onsite-Searches.

3) Das haben wir doch ausgeschlossen? Vgl. https://jira.namics.com/browse/DISTRELEC-2336?focusedCommentId=524137&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-524137
Oder betrifft das etwas anderes?

Bests, Mark

1+2) Okay, ich assigne dir daher diesen Task zurück

3) Du hast recht, habs reverted.

attachment.name: 2014-01-22 14_53_46-Schliesssystem für Desktop und Peripherie _ Distrelec AT Website.png
attachment.author: mdiggelmann

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2824] Product-Image Gallery
item.description:
Vgl. http://test.distrelec.at/de/Widerstand-150-kOhm-1-W-%C2%B1-5-%25-VE=1000Stk--Vishay-PR01/p/16056865

und

http://test.distrelec.at/de/Schliesssystem-f%C3%BCr-Desktop-und-Peripherie-Kensington-K64615EU/p/11026276?q=*&filter_Category3=B%C3%BCrozubeh%C3%B6r&filter_Buyable=1&page=4&origPageSize=10&simi=100

bzw. die angehängten Screenshots der beiden Requests.

1) Es werden gleichzeitig 2 Positionen ausgegeben (ck520): '4;14' bzw. '4;144'

Vgl. auch die Wert-Übergaben in den beiden Parametern ck523 und ck525.

-> Please refactor

Thx Mark
item.summary: Product-Image Gallery

comments.comment:
1) There were two issues involved:

First, I removed the Teaser Tracking from the first visible Item in the Product Image Gallery, because this is already tracked via Page Tracking. This lead to the request containing two Product IDs.

The second issue was and still is, that the first and the last Product in the "Ähnliche Produkte" List is tracked (this is why 144 is the position in your screenshot). I attached a Screenshot where you can see, that the first and the last item is tracked. Please check the implementation and report back, what we need to change.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2942] Content Navigation: Adaptation for Nav to start on level 2
item.description:
The footer navigatio nodes (AT) currently contains the points

  • Services
  • Über uns
  • Hersteller Shops
  • Quick Links

When you click on any of those 1st level footer nav points, the left-hand navigation on the respective content page lists the above mentioned points as level 1, and their children as level 2.

This causes issues as for some contents, 3 levels would be needed.

Requested Change
Have the left-hand navigation start on level 2, so that they don't list Services, Über uns, ...; but instead their children.

In the case of "Über uns" it would be

  • Unternehmen
  • Werte
  • Distrelec Management
  • Presse
  • Jobs
  • Qualität & Umwelt
  • Kontakt
item.summary: Content Navigation: Adaptation for Nav to start on level 2

comments.comment:
Raphael,
please implement as discussed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2926] Order confirmation PDF
item.description:
Attribut issue at the customers payment and delivery addresses on order confirmation PDF (Attached).

$StringEscapeUtils.escapeXml($paymentAddress.lastname$)
StringEscapeUtils.escapeXml($deliveryAddress.lastname)
item.summary: Order confirmation PDF

comments.comment:
Comment von Lukas:

ja, da fehlt ein ! hinter dem $ beim lastname attribut, deshalb wird das so rausgerendert.
das erklärt allerdings nicht, warum die lastname property leer ist...

Anmerkung: Damit im default case nicht dargestellt wird, muss das ! vor dem ersten $ sein:

-> $!StringEscapeUtils.escapeHtml($deliveryAddress.lastname)

The Movex customer ID is also missing in the confirmation PDF (Distrelec Kundennummer)
My test customer has the ID: 9146771

The attribute title of the "comment" field isn't there as well (attached an order with comment "mobile").

fixed:
- add ! to output variables
- customer number
- title for delivery note

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2925] Category Navigation: Category Name cut by half on the third line
item.description:
Go on "Kompontenten" / "Relais & Schalter".

The third line should be completely visible.
item.summary: Category Navigation: Category Name cut by half on the third line

comments.comment: Duplicates DISTRELEC-2907, resolving this issue

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2917] Left Navigation in the static page
item.description:
Step 1: I am in the Services node, on a page
Step 2: I try to open Unternehmen

It expands, but it rolls back immediatly and I do not have time to click anything else.
item.summary: Left Navigation in the static page

comments.comment: Dominic: please have a look, if it's a FE problem. if not please assign to Raphael Husi

Issue: The "Über uns" Navigation node has an empty href Attribute. This triggers a reload of the current page when clicked.
Solution: Add a href Attribute to the Navigation Node.

It may be a good idea to add a check for empty value of navRootNodeUrl in the nav-conten/nav-content.jsp file in order to prevent this issue in the future.
Please also consider DISTRELEC-2942 - not sure if this ticket would be obsolete in the context of the CR?

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2916] Prices < 1 lead to wrong price conversion for analytics
item.description:
Currently, if a product has a price lower than 1Chf or 1 Euro, there is a Format Exception while formatting the price within the terrific <format:analyticsPrice Tag.

Somehow it does not convert the price from e.g. 0,47 Euro to 0.47 Euro. Example can be found here: http://test.distrelec.at/de/Scheibe-f%C3%BCr-Ringkern-Drossel-Noratel-PLASTRONDELL-25MM-2101017/p/15870829 It also happens on the Cart page and probably on all pages having a product / total cart price for analytics.

I tried to set a price of a product lower than 1 locally but there was some validation Problem within the hmc..
item.summary: Prices < 1 lead to wrong price conversion for analytics

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2865] "Einkaufsliste" changes to "shopping list" after logging in in Austria
item.description:
"Einkaufsliste" changes to "shopping list" after logging in in Austria

Applies to

  • meta navigation menu
  • actual shopping list page

Possibly two different properties?
item.summary: "Einkaufsliste" changes to "shopping list" after logging in in Austria

comments.comment:
Could you please attach a screen shot?
Thanks
Assign this ticket to me afterwards.

See attached.
It only applies when logged in.

The menu correctly shows "Einkaufsliste" instead of "Shopping List" when logged out.

The issue was that a message key was taken to create new shopping list that was not in the property file. In that case "Shopping List" was taken as default name.
I have added the missing property, but all shopping lists that have been created will still have the old naming "Shopping List".

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2611] Approval Overview Page shows the wrong content if reques rejected
item.description:
-Login as customer17-145 (distrelec.testing+17-145@gmail.com)
-Add 1000x product 001402 to cart
-Go to cart
-Further with the checkout process and send approval request
-Login as customer 17
-Go to approval requests
-Open request from customer 17-145
-Click button reject
-Add comment "nop" Click button send
->Thanks for ordering page will open... this is not correct!!!

Win7/IE9
item.summary: Approval Overview Page shows the wrong content if reques rejected

comments.comment: Please redirect to the correct page if an approval request has been rejected.
What is the correct URL? Is it the URL of order approval requests list ? (i.e., /my-account/order-approval ) ?
Now it should return back to the order approval list

Is there still a todo on this or can it be resolved? If yes, was it part of release v0.5.10?

If it is still open please assign to the developer responsible.
Thanks
To test
ok
It happens again
According to Florian, the correct behavior should redirect to the order confirmation page. So the displayed page is correct
